Class BackupConfig

Used to configure settings for backup operations.

BufferSize

Configures the size of the buffer, in bytes, to read from the database. Default is 1 megabyte.

Declaration
public uint BufferSize { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.UInt32

Defaults to one megabyte (1024).

View Source

PageReads

Configures the number of pages to read before pausing.

Declaration
public uint PageReads { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.UInt32
Remarks

Increasing this value increases the amount of I/O the backup process performs for any given time interval. If your application is already heavily I/O bound, setting this value to a lower number may help to improve your overall data throughput by reducing the I/O demands placed on your system.

By default, all pages are read without a pause.

View Source

ReadSleep

Configures the number of microseconds to sleep between batches of reads.

Declaration
public uint ReadSleep { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.UInt32
Remarks

Increasing this value decreases the amount of I/O the backup process performs for any given time interval. If your application is already heavily I/O bound, setting this value to a higher number may help to improve your overall data throughput by reducing the I/O demands placed on your system.

View Source

WriteDirect

Turning this on causes direct I/O to be used when writing pages to the disk.

Declaration
public bool WriteDirect { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean
Remarks

For some environments, direct I/O can provide faster write throughput, but usually it is slower because the OS buffer pool offers asynchronous activity.

By default, this option is turned off.

False
